business.headline: PM Modi in UK for FTA: Cheaper scotch and cars on cardsPrime Minister Narendra Modi is in the UK for a meeting with the UK Prime Minister and is also expected to meet King Charles III, with the India-UK Free Trade Agreement (FTA) being the main focus. This agreement is set to provide significant market access to Indian sectors like fisheries, textiles, gems, jewellery, and leather, with a potential market size of $5.2 billion in the UK for the fisheries sector alone.

Money matters, but joy matters more: Edelweiss' Radhika Gupta's mantra for lifeMany young earners feel constant pressure to save every rupee for the future. It's common to hear advice about building a fat retirement fund or aiming for the highest returns. But Radhika Gupta wants people to know that money is only useful if it also makes your present better.

Exports to software: How India's economy will benefit from UK trade dealThe trade agreement was signed by India's Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal and the UK's Secretary of State for Business and Trade, Jonathan Reynolds.

Sensex ends 542 points lower, Nifty below 25,100 as volatility weighs heavyThe S&P BSE Sensex ended 542.47 points lower at 82,184.17, while the NSE Nifty50 declined 157.80 points to close at 25,062.10. Selling pressure was visible across sectors, with FMCG, IT, and financial stocks dragging the indices down.

Small shopkeepers are turning away from UPI paymentsAccording to the National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI), UPI saw over 14.04 billion transactions in June 2024. Yet, for many at the grassroots, the system seems too complex and risky to fully embrace.
ED raids hit Anil Ambani stocks: Reliance Power, Infra sink 5%Reliance Infrastructure has lost 9.37% in the past five trading sessions, Reliance Power has fallen by 7.41% during the same period.

Filed the wrong ITR form? Here's how to fix it to avoid penaltyMany taxpayers only spot mistakes after hitting 'Submit'. Filing the wrong form can snowball into bigger headaches later, from refund delays to unexpected penalties. But tax experts say you do have ways to set things right, provided you act quickly.

Sensex plunges 600 points. Why is the stock market down today?The S&P BSE Sensex dropped 592.85 points to 82,133.79 by 1:04 pm, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 169.25 points to 25,050.65. All broader market indices were in the red as market sentiment weakened.

EPFO now on DigiLocker: See how it helps youThe government has been making several digital changes for EPFO members in the last few months. This new feature on DigiLocker is another step to make your provident fund details more accessible.

Loan, lies and bribery? Why Anil Ambani is facing ED heatMultiple agencies, including the National Housing Bank, the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi), the National Financial Reporting Authority (NFRA), and Bank of Baroda shared findings and inputs that contributed to the investigation.
India-UK FTA: What's on the table in landmark $34 billion deal?For Indian businesses, the FTA opens up wider access to British markets by slashing tariffs and easing compliance.

No penalty for missed income tax deadlines? Panel suggests in New Tax BillThe suggestions come from the Select Committee, which has studied the new Income Tax Bill, 2025. This new Bill is meant to replace the old Income Tax Act of 1961.

entertainment.headline: Vicky Kaushal celebrates 10 years of Masaan: So much to learn, to growVicky Kaushal clocked 10 years of his iconic debut film 'Masaan' on Thursday. As the film turned a decade old, the actor reflected on his growth and learnings.

Mohit Suri honours Sandeep Vanga's fire and fearlessness as Saiyaara stirs heartsAs 'Saiyaara' soars to success, director Mohit Suri dedicates a special note to fellow filmmaker Sandeep Reddy Vanga for supporting his film publicly even before its release.

Nushrratt Bharuccha on sexism in Bollywood: Hero's vanity van nicer than mineActor Nushrratt Bharuccha recalled instances of sexism and inequality in Bollywood. She stated in a recent interview that there have been times when she sought permission to use the hero's vanity van because they are nicer than hers.

Vetri Maaran's Bad Girl teaser removed from YouTube over minor portrayal problemThe Madras High Court has ordered the removal of the 'Bad Girl' film teaser from social media due to concerns of inappropriate portrayal of minors, classifying it as child pornography.

Did Ahaan Panday-Tara Sutaria date each other? Their old pic sparks buzzAhaan Panday's debut in Mohit Suri's 'Saiyaara' has drawn attention, but a resurfaced teenage photo with Tara Sutaria has sparked fresh rumours of a past romance.

Selena Gomez's Only Murders 5 release date announced: When and where to watchSinger-actor Selena Gomez's 'Only Murders In The Building' is all set for the release of its 5th season. Here's everything about the release.

Sacha Baron Cohen flaunts six-pack for Marvel role, thanks OzempicActor Sacha Baron Cohen posted his Men's Fitness UK cover on Instagram on Wednesday. He revealed his sculpted physique in a series of shirtless photos.

Maareesan review: Fahadh-Vadivelu's road trip takes wrong turn post-intervalRelease Date:Fri Jul 25, 2025Maareesan movie review: Director Sudheesh Sankar's 'Maareesan', starring Vadivelu and Fahadh Faasil, is a comedy thriller. While the film wows you with a brilliant first half, it takes a formulaic turn in the second half.

Huma Qureshi's Bayaan to premiere at TIFF 2025 as only Indian filmActor Huma Qureshi's film 'Bayaan' will have its world premiere at TIFF 2025. The film directed by Bikas Ranjan Mishra has been selected for the prestigious global festival's Discovery section.

DJ Snake returns to India with a six-city tour: I've missed your energyDJ Snake is set to return to India with a six-city tour in September. He will kick off his tour in Kolkata on September 26 and wrap it up in Delhi-NCR on October 5.

No retakes, no scripts: The Traitors India director on filming show real-time'The Traitors India' director Nishant Nayak shared insights on directing the reality TV show with no retakes and live filming. In an interview with India Today, he highlighted how authenticity and Indian sensibilities shaped the unique adaptation.

Taylor Swift's Eras Tour looks turned into 13 wax statues at Madame TussaudsMadame Tussauds has unveiled 13 new wax figures of Taylor Swift, capturing her iconic looks from the record-breaking Eras Tour across 13 cities worldwide. This historic release celebrates Swift's immense influence in music and fashion, offering fans a unique experience of her legendary style.

Aneet Padda avoids paparazzi, selfies with fans amid Saiyaara success. WatchActor Aneet Padda recently avoided paparazzi and selfies with fans. She preferred to stay low profile amid the success of her latest film, 'Saiyaara'.

Tamannaah Bhatia dazzles in Rahul Mishra's Sufi-inspired couture collectionActor Tamannaah Bhatia walked the ramp for designer Rahul Mishraat at the Hyundai India Couture Week 2025 in New Delhi on Wednesday. She unveiled the 'Becoming Love' collection with two stunning outfits.

Hari Hara Veera Mallu box office Day 1 prediction: Pawan Kalyan's biggest opener yet'Hari Hara Veera Mallu' is looking at surpassing the opening-day figures of Pawan Kalyan's 'Vakeel Saab' to become the biggest opener of his career. The film has recorded tremendous traction in advance sales.

Janhvi Kapoor reacts to man kicking clinic receptionist: Nothing excuses thisActor Janhvi Kapoor recently reacted to the viral incident where a man allegedly kicked and dragged a clinic receptionist. The actor questioned such sort of upbringing and demanded strict punishment.

Prince Harry and Meghan Markle's $100 million Netflix deal to end without renewalPrince Harry and Meghan Markle's Netflix deal will end this year without renewal. The partnership, valued at approximately $100 million, has now reportedly "run its course". The deal was signed in 2020.

Uorfi Javed's swollen face heals, attends Delhi event after lip filler removalJust a day after revealing the swelling caused by dissolving her lip fillers, Uorfi Javed made a confident public appearance at India Couture Week in Delhi, looking completely normal. The actor-influencer recently got her lip fillers dissolved.

Exclusive: Don 3 makers to recreate 'Aaj Ki Raat' style track with Kriti Sanon 'Don 3', the highly anticipated Bollywood reboot, will star Ranveer Singh and Kriti Sanon in lead roles. The makers are planning a special dance track, similar to 'Aaj Ki Raat'.

general news.headline: PM Modi, Starmer sign historic free trade deal, UK's biggest since leaving EUIndia and the UK signed a landmark Free Trade Agreement (FTA), the biggest agreement London has inked with a country since exiting the EU and gives a major boost to bilateral trade by USD 34 billion annually.

BCCI agrees to host Asia Cup in neutral venue, India-Pak likely in same groupAsia Cup 2025: The Indian cricket board has agreed to host the T20 tournament at a neutral venue. Discussions about the tournament were held at Thursday's Asian Cricket Council meeting.

Did High Court apply its mind? Supreme Court fumes over bail to actor DarshanThe Supreme Court reserved its order on the Karnataka government's plea challenging bail to actor Darshan in the Renukaswamy murder case. The bench called the High Court's bail order a perverse exercise of discretion.

4th Test Day 2 Live: India go past 300, Pant available to batIndia (IND) vs England (ENG), 4th Test, Day 2 Live Score and Updates: Jofra Archer has got the early wicket of Ravindra Jadeja as England have got an early breakthrough. Washington Sundar has joined Shardul Thakur in the middle with the English bowlers looking dangerous.

Ancient Hindu temple with Shivling and the Thailand-Cambodia warAncient Hindu temples are part of the area, the dispute over which has sparked a war between Thailand and Cambodia. The clashes began after Cambodian drones were reportedly spotted near the Ta Muen Temple Complex, a group of 11th-century Khmer Hindu temples dedicated to Lord Shiva. This is all about the 1,000-year-old Prasat Ta Muen Thom temple and how it turned into a Buddhist centre.

Exports to software: How India's economy will benefit from UK trade dealThe trade agreement was signed by India's Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal and the UK's Secretary of State for Business and Trade, Jonathan Reynolds.

Aviation regulator warned Air India over crew fatigue, training lapses: ReportAviation regulator had warned Air India of possible enforcement action over repeated safety violations related to crew fatigue, inadequate training, and compliance failures.

How India's strategic assets lie exposed, vulnerable to harmWith detailed imagery of military bases, nuclear plants, border posts and more easily accessible to Open Source Intelligence, how dangerous is this for national security?

Video: Mumbai woman's Aura Farming dance on moving car as boyfriend drives for reelThe Aura Farming dance, also known as the iconic "boat dance", was made popular by an 11-year-old Indonesian boy, Rayyan Arkan Dikha, who has now become an internet sensation.

US cautions Green Card, visa holders, carry papers always or face fineThe US Customs and Border Protection (CBP) has warned all non-citizens, including green card holders, to carry their registration documents at all times or risk fines and misdemeanour charges. This requirement is based on federal law and applies to all non-citizens aged 18 and older. The advisory affects millions, including Indians, who form the second-largest immigrant group in the US.

Man follows woman, forcibly bites her lips on Bengaluru street, arrestedA man in Bengaluru's Govindapura area allegedly bit a woman's lip in public after following and harassing her. The incident occurred while she was out to buy ration. Police have arrested the accused.

F-16 jets, rocket strikes: Why 'friends' Thailand and Cambodia are at warThe Thailand-Cambodia border region has become the site of a deadly clash between the two Southeast Asian neighbours over a simmering territorial dispute, leaving over 10 civilians and soldiers dead.

Full clearance for Dhruv helicopter fleet pending amid ongoing reviewThe Dhruv, manufactured by Hindustan Aeronautics Limited (HAL), is considered the backbone of India's rotary-wing operations, with over 180 operated by the Army alone, including 60 weaponised Rudra variants.

How a pendant could get Suresh Gopi into jaws of lawUnion Minister Suresh Gopi is facing legal scrutiny after visuals showed him wearing a suspected leopard tooth pendant, potentially violating the Wildlife Protection Act 1972. Possession of animal parts is punished by a jail term of up to 7 years. A probe has been initiated after a complaint by a Youth Congress leader.

Rishabh Pant: Cricket's resilient Sonchiriya dancing to destiny's musicLike the dacoits in Sonchiriya, Rishabh Pant walks a path shadowed by omens. But each time, he lifts the dead snake and keeps moving, saying 'mai ka naam le ke aage badho'.

Centre says no to Parliament discussion on Bihar roll revision, snubs oppositionTop government sources said the Bihar electoral roll revision exercise was being undertaken solely by the Election Commission (ECI), and not the Centre.

Russian plane crashes killing all 49 aboard, pilot error during landing suspectedA Russian passenger plane operated by Angara airline crashed near Tynda in the Far East on Monday, killing all 49 on board -- including five children -- after losing contact with air traffic control during a second landing attempt in poor visibility, with pilot error or technical malfunction suspected.

Assam engineer dies by suicide, says forced to clear inflated bills in noteJoshita Das, 30, was posted with the PWD department in Bongaigaon for nearly a year. She was found hanging in her room, and a handwritten suicide note was found by the police.

Bengaluru stampede: RCB, cops to face action as Karnataka approves probe reportThe Karnataka cabinet has approved the Justice Cunha report on the June 4 stampede outside Chinnaswamy Stadium that killed 11. Action will be taken against RCB, KSCA, DNA, and police officials. The report cites gross negligence.

South Africa name squads for Australia tour, Pretorius earns ODI call-upAiden Markram and Temba Bavuma made their comebacks while Lhuan-dre Pretorius earned a maiden ODI call-up as Australia named their squads for the tour of Australia.

India to tour England again in 2026 for white-ball series, schedule announcedIndia will tour England in July 2026 for an eight-match white-ball series including five T20Is and three ODIs. The summer also features England hosting Pakistan and Sri Lanka, plus the first-ever women's Test at Lord's, marking a historic cricket season.

Parthiv Patel weighsENG vs IND: Speaking to Rishabh Pant's toe injury, Parthiv Patel said that he's okay with the ICC's rule of like-for-like replacement of wicketkeepers where the incoming player won't be allowed to bat and will only be allowed to keep wickets.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
